meanings.definition: The act of emerging or coming into view.
meanings.sent1: The mergence of the sun over the horizon was a beautiful sight.
meanings.sent2: The mergence of the new moon signaled the start of the lunar cycle.
meanings.sent3: The mergence of the shy rabbit from its burrow made everyone smile.
meanings.sent4: The mergence of the truth from the shadows brought clarity to the situation.
meanings.sent5: The mergence of the colorful flowers in the garden created a stunning display.

meanings.definition: The process of becoming involved or associated with something.
meanings.sent1: Her mergence into the book club introduced her to new friends.
meanings.sent2: The mergence of the students into the project showed their dedication.
meanings.sent3: His mergence into the dance class surprised everyone.
meanings.sent4: The mergence of the team into the competition brought out their competitive spirit.
meanings.sent5: The mergence of the puppy into the family filled their home with joy.

meanings.definition: The act of combining or blending together.
meanings.sent1: The mergence of flavors in the soup created a delicious taste.
meanings.sent2: The mergence of colors in the painting gave it a vibrant look.
meanings.sent3: The mergence of styles in the music band made their sound unique.
meanings.sent4: The mergence of scents in the garden perfume was enchanting.
meanings.sent5: The mergence of ingredients in the recipe resulted in a mouth-watering dish.
